alert.note: Alert for Emmons (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 18 at 9:25PM CDT until further notice by NWS Bismarck
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in North Dakota... Beaver Creek below Linton affecting Emmons County. .Warm temperatures will melt snowpack and increase river flows. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Beaver Creek below Linton. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, This is flood stage for Beaver Creek with water spilling out of banks and into low-lying areas near the stream. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 PM CDT Friday the stage was 13.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:00 PM CDT Friday was 13.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/bis. The next statement will be issued by the end of Saturday morning.
